metadata.title: CVE-2021-28677 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Pillow before 8.2.0. For EPS data, the readlineimplementation used in EPSImageFile has to deal with any combination of \rand \n as line endings. It used an accidentally quadratic method ofaccumulating lines while looking for a line ending. A malicious EPS filecould use this to perform a DoS of Pillow in the open phase, before animage was accepted for opening.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-28677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6
python-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6
python3-pil - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6
python3-pil.imagetk - 5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: pillow package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.1.0-1ubuntu0.6').
